questions.question: I ............................... in Qatar when I was young.
questions.description: We use the simple past to talk about past events when there is a reference to the past time.

questions.question: I ...................................... her since that incident.
questions.description: Perfect tenses are more common with the time expressions since and for.

questions.question: I .................................... the parcel yesterday.
questions.description: We use the simple past to say when something happened.

questions.question: They ...................................... the contract last week.
questions.description: We use the simple past to say when something happened.

questions.question: ............................................ anything from them yet?
questions.description: The present perfect is common with the time expressions yet, already, ever, never etc.

questions.question: We ........................................ since morning.
questions.description: We use the present perfect or present perfect continuous tense with the time expressions since and for.

questions.question: I ...................................... to Jaipur last month.
questions.description: We use the simple past to say when something happened.

questions.question: ......................................... to Japan?
questions.description: With the time expressions ever and never, the present perfect is common.

questions.question: I .................................... school when I was
questions.description: We use the simple past to say when something happened.

questions.question: You won't be able to see her because she .................................... home.
questions.description: We use the present perfect to talk about finished events whose effect is felt in the present.

questions.question: This is the first time I ..................................... a tiger.
questions.description: The present perfect is used with the expressions 'this is the first/second time'.
